Message.Title: Better get that Alibaba IPO out quick
Message.Msg: Before the next wave of bird flu TWO men suffering from a lesser-known type of bird flu have died in Shanghai and a woman in eastern Anhui Province is in a critical condition, health authorities said yesterday. The three cases of H7N9 avian influenza infection are the first time the virus has been detected in humans, the National Health and Family Planning Commission said yesterday. So far there is no vaccination for the virus, it said. The men were an 87-year-old surnamed Li who took ill on February 19 and died on March 4, and a 27-year-old surnamed Wu who became ill on February 27 and died on March 10. (WHO is concerned because they all became infected separately, ie there are three different loci where the H7N9 virus was transmitted from some source to humans)

Message.Title: CCUR Could Gap Up and Explode Tomorrow, Look at Chart!
Message.Msg: Concurrent (CCUR) is about to become the #1 hottest play in the market. CCUR has gained 12 straight months and 8 of the past 9 trading days. It has the best looking chart in the market with the most momentum! CCUR's run is about to accelerate tomorrow! CCUR is $7.91 per share with 9.2mm o/s $24.6mm in cash no debt enterprise value $48.17mm or just 0.77X trailing revenue of $62.59mm. After $8 resistance it potentially soars to $12-$15 within a week or two! CCUR's EPS last quarter was double quarter before and quadruple two quarters ago. CCUR's #1 competitor Seachange (SEAC) is $11.89 per share and projected to soon to report full year non-GAAP EPS of $0.40, giving it a P/E of 30. CCUR's non-GAAP EPS last quarter of $0.125 equals $0.50 annualized and a P/E of 30 would value CCUR at $15! CCUR's enterprise value/revenue ratio of 0.77 is 60% below SEAC's enterprise value/revenue ratio of 1.89! CCUR has gross margins of 58.81% vs SEAC's gross margins of 50.18%. CCUR could match SEAC's EV/revenue ratio of 1.89 early this month, which will value CCUR at $15.53! CCUR is pay-TV industry's video on demand (VOD) software leader. CCUR and SEAC combine for a total worldwide VOD market share of greater than 50%. CCUR's MediaHawk VOD platform reaches 54mm global VOD homes including 23mm U.S. VOD homes. Free-on-demand (FOD) is currently the world's fastest growing video delivery platform with 17% growth last year to 6.8 billion transactions. CCUR's breakthrough MediaHawk ad insertion technology will allow the industry to begin generating $1 billion in new annual revs by selling FOD ad space. CCUR was just awarded U.S. patent for VOD ad insertion into the "trick mode" (when fast-forward function is in use), which makes CCUR the first to solve the one major concern advertisers have about VOD advertising - ad skipping. Many pay TV companies plan to block trick mode access altogether, which will cause a major backlash from their subscribers!
